tariff_entries.supply_service_charges: Company supplied Electricity Supply Service charges shall be set according to the market price of electricity determined in accordance with Rule 46.1, Electricity Supply Cost.
adjustments_to_standard_tariff_rates_and: Rule 40.1.8 - Value of Distributed Energy Resources’ Customer Benefit Contribution Charge
Rule 40.3 - Value of Distributed Energy Resource (VDER) Value Stack Cost Recovery Surcharge
Rule 59 - Arrears Management Program Recovery (AMP) Surcharge
tariff_entries.increase_in_rate_and_charges: The charges under this Service Classification, including minimum charge, will be increased by a tax factor pursuant to Rule 32.
tariff_entries.terms_of_payment: Bills are due and payable when rendered. Full payment must be received on or before the date shown on the bill to avoid a late payment charge pursuant to Rule 26.4.
tariff_entries.term: One month and continuously from month to month thereafter until permanently terminated on three days’ notice to Company, or one year, and thereafter until terminated as provided in the written application for service.

special_provisions.A: Service under this Service Classification is primarily intended for residential customers residing in individual dwelling units. Minor professional or commercial operations allowed under conditions.
special_provisions.B: Customers in good standing have the option, with consent of the Company, of paying for service under the Company's Monthly Budget Plan.
special_provisions.C: Customers converting to electric space heating without complying with minimum insulation requirements will be required to pay a surcharge of 25% of their total bill.
special_provisions.D: Quarterly Payment Plan available for residential customers 62 years or older with average annual billing not more than $150.
special_provisions.E: Residential status will not begin earlier than October 1991 meter reading for customers eligible based on multiple occupancy building clause.
special_provisions.F: Net Energy Billing for Customers Operating Solar Electric Generating Equipment per Rule 36.
special_provisions.H: On-Site Generation Special Provision - Customers must certify on-site generation installations and may be subject to Service Classification No. 7 unless isolated or emergency power system.

I.description: Residential rate applicable to use predominantly or primarily in connection with religious purposes by qualifying organizations.
I.eligibility: Organization must have fundamental religious purpose and property used primarily in support.
I.evidence_of_eligibility: Includes articles of incorporation, charters, letters from recognized religious organizations, IRS eligibility, or other documentation.
non_qualifying_uses: Recreational Facilities, Health Clubs or Physical Fitness Facilities
Publication of Religious Literature and Supplies
Stores for Sale of Religious Articles or Sacramental Wines
Lodging Homes or Quarters, unless otherwise applicable under SC-1
Clothing Stores, Thrift Stores or Donation Centers
I.use_conditions: Electricity supplied only if predominant use is religious or reasonably incidental. Non-religious uses must be segregated and separately metered or entire premise billed non-residential.

special_provisions.J: Net Energy Billing for Certain Customers Operating Farm Waste Electric Generating Equipment per Rule 36.
special_provisions.K: Net Energy Billing for Certain Customers Operating Wind Electric Generating Equipment per Rule 37.

L.description: Residential Optional Time of Use Delivery and Commodity Rate

time_periods.Super Peak: Summer (Jun-Jul-Aug) 2:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m., weekdays only (excluding weekends and holidays)
time_periods.On Peak: 7:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. all year round
time_periods.Off Peak: 11:00 p.m. to 7:00 a.m. all year round

L.incremental_customer_charge_waiver: Waived for customers with verified plug-in electric vehicle or participating in Clifton Park Demand Reduction REV Demonstration Project.
L.term: One year from commencement and continuously thereafter until canceled upon written notice.
L.one_time_option_for_pev_owners: After initial one year, customers with PEV may receive a 12-month charge comparison and refund difference if SC1 standard tariff is lower.

M.eligibility: Applicants must be customer of record and enrolled in specified assistance programs or provide documentation of Federal Lifeline or qualifying public assistance.

tiers.Tier 1: Regular Emergency HEAP Payment, and/or Non-Utility HEAP Benefit, Self-Identified and File Match

M.enrollment: Automatic upon receipt of HEAP benefit or identification through OTDA mechanisms or self-identification with documentation.
M.budget_plan: Customers with no arrears automatically enrolled in Monthly Budget Plan, with option to opt out.
M.credits: Amount of each tier’s credit found on Statement of Energy Affordability Credit (EAC).

N.description: Residential Electric Vehicle Charge Smart Plan (EV Charge Smart Plan)
N.eligibility: Residential customers under this service classification except those under Special Provision L.
N.incentive: Monthly Charge Smart Incentive for charging EV during off-peak period (11:00 pm to 7:00 am).
criteria: Total EV charging in month at or above minimum kWh charging requirement.
Percentage of EV charging during off-peak at or above off-peak charging percentage.
N.incentive_determination: Set by Company and updated annually or as needed.
N.billing: Customers billed all SC1 charges including EV charging usage.
N.enrollment: Must complete enrollment 30 days prior to first billing under plan.
N.unenrollment: Allowed anytime after minimum 3 months if enrollment incentive received.
N.measurement: EV off-peak usage measured by qualifying networked EV charger or device; customer responsible for installation and maintenance.
